website_summaries.verdict: These shears are designed to handle all types of material with ease in both the medical field and the workshop.
pros: Heavy material indicates durability and hardiness
cons: Cutting can feel a bit "stiff" on occasion
Some find these shears to be too big

customer_reviews.title: Don't get rubbing alcohol on it...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cuts very well and the finger holes accommodate large fingers Cons: There's something wrong with the coating. If you get rubbing alcohol on the blades, the black coating flakes off onto all surrounding surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I don’t understand the five star reviews.
customer_reviews.text: These arrived tightly screwed and while opening and closing a few times to assess whether I needed to oil them the coating started to flake off. I do not recommend these without adjusting for the tightness. The coating could be otherwise be tolerated if used in an emergency kit only.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Trauma Sheers
customer_reviews.text: Update 8/13/17 - After a little over one year of use in the ER, cutting off patients' clothes and cutting orthoglass, these shears have significantly dulled. They were very good for a long time but now need to be replaced. I will probably look to purchase a more durable pair of shears in the future. Original review: Excellent trauma sheers. I work in an ER and these have never failed me. They cut through jeans, belts, et cetera, with ease. I also use them to cut fiberglass when making splints. I have noticed over time that they are starting to lose a little bit of their power, but they still get the job done well. Would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah P

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased this very functional item much sooner
customer_reviews.text: Having an elderly relative with medical issues is bad enough, and then worrying about cutting the person makes for an even worse situation. Since he has to wear three-layer compression wraps on his legs, I feared cutting him when they needed to be taken off. Regular scissors were often awkward plus not very efficient, and I had to make certain to keep the point away from his leg. But with this wonderful product, I can cut away the wrap without worry. The Madison Supply scissors are sharp, yet the blunt tip keeps me from causing any additional harm. Wish I had purchased this very functional item much sooner.
customer_reviews.author: A. Richard

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Great scissors! They cut clothes with a breeze. I'm a nursing student and need good bandage scissors, and I love these! They are a little big for my hands, but that's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Fortich

customer_reviews.title: Real safe cut offs.
customer_reviews.text: I have to have my legs wrapped at a wound clinic and if I want to shower I have to cut the wraps off. I have many pairs of pointed scissors but these safety scissors have worked very very well for two months and I feel much safer when cutting with them. Also the wraps are three layers thick and these cut very efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: but the other pair I've had in use looks like the central pin is rusting as well and ready ...
customer_reviews.text: These shears literally fell apart after 10-12 uses. The central pin holding the two blades together quickly rusted after only two to three washes. They were not put in the autoclave - even though the handle says ok to autoclave up to 143 celsius. I'd say maybe I got one defective pair, but the other pair I've had in use looks like the central pin is rusting as well and ready to break loose anytime. Do not recommend due to poor build quality and/or design flaw. I will be trying to get my money back as the performance of this product is unacceptably bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Received bent scissors
customer_reviews.text: I received the scissors bent didn’t notice till I got to work and tried cutting pressure dressing’s took me about a good hour to figure out why all my dressings were being cut crooked very disappointed in this purchase will not be buying from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: Deandra Tavira

customer_reviews.title: They came perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box everything is in perfect shape. I bought a pair of these for my vehicle trauma kits for each of my cars. These have the highest ratings and the most reviews. Theirs nothing I can really add. Other then the showed up in perfect working order. I can say I hope they get little to no use. But I’m confident if the time comes. That they will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P

customer_reviews.title: Hunting for quality shears?
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these is fantastic. I've purchased three sets of these for our medical cabinet, bug out bags, and car medical kits. They cut so well that I want to use them for everything, but decided to only use them for medical purposes. They don't seem to get tape stuck to them and the cuts are very clean. They feel sturdy and do not flex under stress. They work like a true professional tool. These shears are head and shoulders above the others I've used. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: S. Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Using these as diver's cutter tool
customer_reviews.text: Thought these would be a bit safer to use for cutting through entanglements, etc., while scuba diving. They appear very well made and seem to be durable for a water environment. My dive instructor was also impressed with it as a cutting tool. Just had to purchase a "made-for-diving" shear for it's sheath to connect to my BCD.
customer_reviews.author: Dino Baldacci

customer_reviews.title: Completely disappointed...twice
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in these. The first pair I received were bowed making it hard to cut and the replacement pair that I got were bowed too (the metal part) and the handle was all scratched/plastic nicked as if they were used/returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amy R.

customer_reviews.title: best purchase i've made for work
customer_reviews.text: Great for boxes, opening those tough plastic bags of IV fluids or meds, cutting tough, thick dressings, those stupid pills that you can't separate nicely in the med room while you're holding fifty other things. Dropped it repeatedly, thrown it haphazardly. I've cleaned with bleach, saniwipes, under running water and the material has not degraded; the black coating has nicks in places only from the abuse that i give it. Pocket space is golden and these shears have earned their place. My name's all over this one. Buying another just so I can have one for personal emergencies. Lots of my coworkers have positively commented on my shears.
customer_reviews.author: Kurry

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for quality scissors.
customer_reviews.text: These feel very durable and well made. Not flimsy or cheap feeling. The edges are a serrated texture so they don’t stick to tape and they cut through thick cardboard paper even. I’m a nurse and I need something dependable and easy to use without worrying about having to scrub adhesive off the scissors. This product delivered exactly that.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great all-purpose shears, as long as you don't need a sharp point
customer_reviews.text: These things are beasts. I dropped a pair into my toolbox and use them to cut cut sandpaper, zip ties, clamshell packages, cardboard, tape, alum foil, the list goes on. They don't make a perfect line since they're kind of micro-serrated on the bottom blade, there's tiny little dimples along the edge when you cut a piece of paper, maybe 0.5mm wide. On a non-impressionable material like cotton the line would be clean. These things have a bit of heft to them, not heavy, but they feel solid, the pivot joint has a consistent friction to it, it feels tight. The blades are thick and the handles are sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: HPLoveshack

customer_reviews.title: Will handle any task you throw at them
customer_reviews.text: By far the best shears I have used at work. First thing you will notice is the solid, sturdy design of these shears. These things are built to last, unlike some cheap, flimsy imitations out there. These will cut through denim, zippers and probably steel with ease. The sturdy grips will allow you to exert the needed force to get the job done without causing any discomfort. If you are considering purchasing a new pair of shears, do yourself a favor and get these. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JTM

customer_reviews.title: I think they will work perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw these I was dismayed at their large size. I thought they would be too heavy for the first aide backpack I intended them for. Then I took them out of the wrapper and realized how light they were and how ergonomically comfortable they would be to use with my arthritic hands. The only problem with them is the very tip, the part that you would slide under a bandage to cut . It has burrs that I will easily file smooth so as not to scratch skin.
customer_reviews.author: WillowDaisy

customer_reviews.title: Medical Shears - 2 pack in Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered a pair of these shears in tactical black some time back and they cut decent enough. But because they were black it was hard to see what was being cut. So I ordered a 2 pack of Stainless Steel shears from Madison Supply and the bright silver color made it much easier to see that only the covering (clothing or bandage) was being cut and still stay far enough away from the wound. This package arrived fairly quickly after placing the order for them. Price was decent as well. I like 'em.
customer_reviews.author: Mike from Jersey

customer_reviews.title: Best medical scissors that I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I have severe lymphedema in my legs and I'm forced to wear thick, multi-layer, short stretch bandages at all times on my legs. Sometimes those bandages get wet and need to come off instantly, without taking the time to unwrap them. In the past the scissors that I've own would have difficulty cutting through the bandages. But when I got this pair of scissors I have not had any trouble instantly cutting through several layers of bandages at once. This is the best pair of medical scissors that I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Duck

customer_reviews.title: I am concern.
customer_reviews.text: They feel nice. However, I rub the blade with fingers and there are paint chip or black flakes that falls off. They are either poor quality control or these are not genuine. Alcohol prep or any alcohol will polarize with these flakes and they will flakes out more. It is a big problem, as it introducing foreign contaminate to patient, would not use around open wound.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Best trauma shears
customer_reviews.text: Update: after nearly 3 years they’re still going strong! Keep these guys in sight at all times: people will take off with them! They'll cut through literally anything! I care for patients in an emergency medicine setting, so I'm mostly using them to cut bandages, clothes, even knee immobilizers. I won't use them on orthoglass as that would be unnecessary wear. I've been using these regularly for over a month. The nonstick coating is excellent, though it can be scratched, and I've been advised not to use any solvents on it such as alcohol as that may remove fluoride. The overall quality of these is clearly superior to any shears supplied by ER. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: W. James

customer_reviews.title: Not the highest quality but great for home or car.
customer_reviews.text: These certainly aren't the highest quality medical shears but the are quite adequate for home or vehicle first aid use. I used a pair to cut a nylon sleeve off of a synthetic winch cable (cordura about like you'd find on a good quality backpack) and it cut through it great. I have no doubt they would cut denim like butter and should work excellent for trimming gauze off a roll. If you are a professional who uses them every day I don't think they would hold up for very long but at home I expect them to last nearly forever.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Ordered a second pair. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Fits well in my husband’s large size hand. Very sturdy unlike some with the flimsy handle and the blades that wiggle. This is an excellent product and I highly recommend. We liked the product so well that we ordered again so He could keep one for work only and we could have another pair for our emergency kit at home.
customer_reviews.author: Melody

customer_reviews.title: Medical Scissors, EMT and Trauma Shears
customer_reviews.text: A great purchase! I bought these after my son broke his leg and needed to be in a full leg cast for months. I used these to cut the large trash bags off after being taped down with waterproof tape for his showers. I never once had an issue nor any significant resistance when cutting through super this plastic and tape. The performed perfectly. I did not experience any rust or the likes, I always wiped/dried them off after each use. They still look today as they did new. Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beageidea

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of scissors!
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of scissors! I never thought that scissors could be great, these are. Great fit in my hand. Great value/ cost. Great cutting action, several layers of gauze and an ABD pad, cut right through! (I do my own, at home dressing changes daily) Handel say can be autoclave to 149 degrees Celsius. (Wow) One last thing, these bad boys are sharp, I was cutting gauze. I think I was distracted by some morning news, an clipped some callus. I mean it happened so quick, I'm happy to add it did not go deep enough to bleed. Tender yes (no blood) whew that was close.
customer_reviews.author: tbarr95

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritis sufferers/ boxes
customer_reviews.text: My apartment has a trash compactor that cardboard boxes seem to mess up a bit, but these scissors are great for cutting up the boxes given my Amazon problem I'm sure more than me has developed since Covid started. (The arthritis in my hands makes using regular scissors hurt my hands too bad)
customer_reviews.author: Rachel B.

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: I've used my first pair for about a year for small game processing, cutting rubber/plastic tubing, cord, copper wire and light sheet steel/aluminum. Can still cut thin paper cleanly. They stay in my truck, and have been a very useful tool where a knife wouldn't work as well. Just bought a second pair for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Neato

customer_reviews.title: Handy Scissors for heavy-duty cutting.
customer_reviews.text: I keep one of the pair I bought with my medical supplies, and, thankfully, have not had to use it yet. The other, though, I keep with my leather-working tools, and they have proved valuable for cutting all but the heaviest of leather, as well as for cutting carpet and heavy cardboard. Time will tell how they hold up to long-term use, but so far, they are great. Frankly, these shears are some of the best tools I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Hans

customer_reviews.title: Very good cutting shears
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, I was concerned with the thickness of fabric these would cut. No worries with this pair of shears! Right out of the Amazon box, I grabbed some blue jeans and started in. The toothed edge does a great job of grabbing material, and the cutting was very easy even through the seam! Nice crisp cutting. Ok, so I grabbed an inter tube; too easy. Next, 1" mil spec webbing; no sweat. Then I doubled up a blue jean seam. This did require a little effort, but right through I cut without the blades spreading or the handles cracking. I was impressed and have gained faith in this product. Recommended for your IFAC or Bleed Out kit.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyann F.

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok, but had some surface quality issues
customer_reviews.text: I decided to get this over the other shears that are half the price because I was hoping to get better quality. The shears feel sturdy and are sharp, but mine had some paint chips flaking off around the scissor blade. I was able to clean it up by cutting up some tin foil and wiping with rubbing alcohol
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found these.
customer_reviews.text: I still have 2 pairs of the OLD Emergency Room Crash Scissors, from the 1970s. I have cut pennies in half with them. I am retired now, but I use the scissors to cut SandPaper into useable sizes & shapes. I just wanted a couple more of them, so I could have one at each of my work benches. The New Ones cut Coarse Sandpaper just fine, just like the Old Crash Scissors. Will they last 40 years?? No way to know, but I'm happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Harold T. Read

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking but a little on the bigger side. I was hesitant to order because I didn’t know how durable or what the coating was made of. It came how it’s pictured but if you get any substance on it like alcohol it will tear down the coating into peeling off. I think these would be great if there was a different coating that could withstand substances! If you’re a medical professional I wouldn’t highly recommend these as first choice but I would purchase this as a backup to hold you over.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra White

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!!!
customer_reviews.text: No regrets buying this...I will buy again if needed...I did notice while using the scissors that right where they pivot. The fluoride coating is scrapping off. No big deal as long as the scissors are stainless steel and don't rust...If they start rusting in that spot i will write another review, but other then that...I love these scissors...I am thinking of buying a second pair as a backup in case i loose the first pair...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: These scissors although inexpensive in price are a quality product that I will use in the care of patients. I am an Emergency Medical Responder and I depend on the products on my person and in my bag to allow me to administer emergency care to patients in the field. When they call 911 we are there to help, I know that I can depend on this product to help me fulfill my duties to our residents. I am very hard on my gear and demand a lot from it, these scissors meet that bill! Thank you for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed in the quality of these...
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased these shears and they were quite useful around the house, I liked them so much that I order another pair. The shears that arrived looked like the ones I'd been using, but they didn't pass the test. After using them for a few days they broke. Not sure if I wanted to gamble buying another pair to see if they last.
customer_reviews.author: dontpanicmorty

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go without!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I’m a registered nurse at a rehab center and they fit comfortably in my scrub pocket. Mostly I cut through different tapes and elastics for catheters so nothing to heavy duty but still love how durable they are. In fact someone at work stole mine so I bought another and had my name put on my new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great price for two trauma shears
customer_reviews.text: Great price for two trauma shears Wanted to add shears to my other first aid kits (both cars). As they are more likely to be needed due to a traffic or drive by situation than at home...already have two pair for the house. Again, another product I hope I never need to use...like the old saying... but best to have it and not need, then to need it and not have it.
customer_reviews.author: Keltic

customer_reviews.title: blade is bent
customer_reviews.text: one of the blades is bent causing immediate wear on one point of the other blade and a lack of contact between the two in the middle. at $12 it's not enough to go through the hassle of returning it but I would definitely recommend trying another brand.
customer_reviews.author: brendan morgan

customer_reviews.title: Medical Shears [ EMT ]. Great!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot go wrong with these shears, If it "says will cut just about Anything!!" Believe them. Bought them to remove plastic zip ties @ work. Works like a charm. IF any medical staff or there of needs "A pair" [ sold on web site ].
customer_reviews.author: Ds_esnce

customer_reviews.title: Great utility scissors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the camping toolkit, not necessarily for anything "medical". I've already proven they're substantially better than the ones found in dollar stores and the like by using them for my favorite test - cutting a penny in half. They did the job without flexing like their cheap counterparts. Since I won't be using them as they're intended, I won't drop a star for the grips, but I will be adding a few layers of Dip-it rubber coating to make them more comfortable. All in all, a good purchase at a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: RagingBuddhist

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have a pair
customer_reviews.text: I bought these medical scissors to go along with my medical kit they are a bit light but they look like they should work just fine. For the price it's a good piece of equipment to add to your first aid kit. I would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Man

customer_reviews.title: My review
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, these scissors are made well, sturdy, and fit nicely into my EMT tactical pouch. I've read a few articles about being in unexpected situations in everyday life by author Tim MacWelsh on the importance of having the right tools (or gear) in an emergency kit. I did the research and these were my selection. I am happy with how light they are and how easily they fit into my small molle emergency pouch, it's better to be prepared, it might just save a life. It also helps that the price was right for the quality I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie  Dorsett

customer_reviews.title: No problems with these
customer_reviews.text: I have waited a while to review these scissors just to see how well they work. They work very well and seem to be better than what I previously used. I've cut thick, heavy cardboard, some 1/4" thick hard felt. sheet plastic, leather, and I'm probably forgetting some stuff and they still cut thin paper with ease. If only the metal was a little thicker, but they are pretty sturdy. Well worth the money! I would not hesitate recommending them.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kemper

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good so far. Would like to have a hook to that I can clip them to my scrubs instead of putting them in my pocket. Be aware, they hack instead of cut stockinette coverings for IV lines
customer_reviews.author: hoosier0893

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but works well
customer_reviews.text: Personally, I would prefer something smaller but hey it does the job. It is very bulky and does not fit in my scrubs very well so it makes it difficult to be on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Makayla

customer_reviews.title: So huge!
customer_reviews.text: Im a nurse but i felt like a beast coming at patients with these shears. Its as if they were made for Goliath. Wayyy to big.
customer_reviews.author: hfig

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: When I started PT in EMS I didn't want to spend a ton on trauma shears, as I wasn't doing a ton of shifts, so I got these based on the reviews. So happy I did. Cutting through thin material or thick winter coats, these have been great. Partners borrow them to get their side cut through, but I always get them back. Ordering another set or two for when they inevitably "walk off." One con... the coating comes off when being cleaned with anything containing alcohol.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Great as kitchen shears and everything else.
customer_reviews.text: I have loved EMT shears since using them at the academy 20+ years ago. And yes, you really can cut a penny in half with these things. I wanted a good set of kitchen shears (which can be pricey) when someone suggested using medical scissors cause "they can cut through anything". The fact that these are stainless makes them perfect for the cause.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Paul

customer_reviews.title: These scissors are the best for in-home use.
customer_reviews.text: When I needed to graduate--quickly--from my trusty orange-handled scissors to a pair the home-health nurse said I needed, I found them on Amazon, just like the nurse said I would. I need to cut bandages off my husband's legs nearly daily. He is recovering from a bout of cellulitis that landed him in a 10-day hospitalization. The home-health nurse and her rehab aid both said that using regular scissors was too dangerous. The slightest nick of the skin--even if drawing no blood--could reintroduce pathogens. The bandage scissors I bought came so quickly, and the nurse was delighted with them. In fact, she said she'd order a pair for herself as a backup. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Joe D.

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors!
customer_reviews.text: These are great bandage scissors! I really like them because they are black so I know they're mine as all of the other ones at work are silver in color.
customer_reviews.author: Ldiddy

customer_reviews.title: Best Scissors
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST SCISSORS EVER!!! I am a treatment nurse and these cut through everything. Highly recommend. Best money I've spent in long time.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great sizzors
customer_reviews.text: Nice sharp medical sizzors with rounded safety end, no point. I bought these to groom my puppy and they work great. Way better than the sizzorscsold for grooming dogs. These medical sizzors were much sharper for easy cutting. No accidentally poking dog. We used same sizzors in ER to cut bandages or clothes off pts
customer_reviews.author: Barbie doll 7

customer_reviews.title: Thin and lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pr.of sisors that would cut my ostomy supplies.thin and lightweight. But I ordered the wrong scissors. My husband threw away the package it came in so will keep them.but they are too heavy and big for what I wanted them for . Oh well, next time.
customer_reviews.author: Judine Brockert

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy. Good clean cut.
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job. They look the same as the non-tyflon coated scissors that I bought from Harbor freight for about $3.50.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R C

customer_reviews.title: Great Scissors, wished I had gotten them sooner
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I had suffered an infection in my right foot which resulted in a TMA (Trans Metatarsal Amputation). My foot was in bandages for months, which needed to be changed daily or a couple times a day. Before getting these scissors, I used a pair of sewing sheers. Cut myself pretty bad a couple times, even though I was being very careful. Once I started using these scissors, the accidental cuts stopped immediately. These things are a godsend, I recommend them to ANYONE that needs to change bandages. For $10 how can you go wrong. They were used every day (or more) for over a year and still look the same as when I took them out of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime customer!
customer_reviews.text: These scissors are absolutely the best. I waited a couple of months before writing my review to give me enough time to use them. All my Orthopaedic doctors and fellow nurses love my new scissors and are always asking to use them. They are super sharp so be very careful when these are in use. I will be a lifetime customer! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great sheers.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sheers! I bought a pair and they worked very well. Unfortunately lost my original set on scene somewhere but ordered another. The hinge is a little tighter with this second set but I carry them into work everyday and use them when need be. The coating looks nice and they're easy to clean with a peroxide wipe. Will definitely buy another set if and when these wear out or get lost again!
customer_reviews.author: Justin N

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: good trauma shears. Purchased Feb 2019. Full time ems 911 only. Has through many things with ease. Starting to stick with opening wd40 fixed it. No complaints. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best boxing scissors ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for scissors to remove hand wraps, you literally can’t find a better pair of scissors on the market. I’ve gone through at least a half dozen pairs of poorly made scissors that can’t cut, or break, or are uncomfortable. These things cut like butter through tape and gauze and make removing wraps a breeze. I can’t recommend these enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nolan

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: These things cut and stay rigid day after day. I’ve used the spectrum of trauma shears -minus the x-shear. These are fantastic and will perform all day every day for you. I’ve cut leather, cloth, denim, cast material (hardened and pre-activated). It isn’t that these are a great product for the money; these are a great product for the job they are built for. This is the price you pay for the tool you need. Don’t spend less and don’t spend more. They work! They don’t let you down! If you pass them off, get them back!
customer_reviews.author: Brhsmith75

customer_reviews.title: They cut like butter
customer_reviews.text: Glad I didn't get anything else. We put these to the test last week. Had to get access to use an AED on a female. It cut right through the shirt and bra. Last pair we had were cheap and would not cut a wet paper bag. The extra cost is well worth it in an emergency!
customer_reviews.author: rodney rowe

customer_reviews.title: I like them a lot!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal on high-quality scissors I've found. Working in a hospital, and being a parent, means I can go through a lot of scissors. The two pack was really worth it. I use them for things around the house, as well as at work. They have a nice stainless steel finish, which set them apart from my all-black ones. Fit and finish is great! They cut everything I need them to. The handle says "AUTOCLAVE 143 deg C". I do not need to do that with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Wavetechlifeguard

customer_reviews.title: These are sturdy and perform well...
customer_reviews.text: I like these scissors very much. They are solid, nice looking, and cut well. If I could ask for one improvement, it would be to make them a little thinner so that they can get under tight bandages a little easier, but it is not a big deal. And, this is probably why they are so sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: robert m wiemer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect scissors for everything
customer_reviews.text: Super sharp, quality scissors! Love the serrated edge. I use them daily for cutting through layers of gauze wrap, duoderm film, foam for wound vacs....they are even maneuverable enough for cutting stoma openings in ostomy flanges...they are light weight yet very durable, and make my many treatments as a med/surg LPN so much easier!!
customer_reviews.author: jasmine72

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional scissors for all purposes
customer_reviews.text: I use these as general purpose scissors and as kitchen shears. They cut paper and packages, slice meat, cut lettuce and other greens for salads and perform every other function you can imagine for a good pair of scissors. I was sick of buying expensive kitchen shears that never did the job for long. Very large finger holes make them comfortable to use. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dale D. Rush

customer_reviews.title: I like the size, color & the price is good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this long, have only used them once. they were very tight, therefore, they get 4 stars. They seem well made by a company that cares. If they, by some unforeseen reason, fail to operate up to the standards the company claims, I will post an update. I am hoping for the best!
customer_reviews.author: T.A.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the one star reviews I found this to be a great replacement for my old shears (different brand) where the handle snapped. This pair madison supply has nice sturdy handles and is quite sharp. Works well for wirecutting and general use.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and love the tactical black color.
customer_reviews.text: Working in the field, i always keep my necessary medical supplies with my gear. These are very good quality, lightweight, i love the tactical black color and they are very easy to use. Anyone looking for quality sheers - these are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: GetFit NoExcuses

customer_reviews.title: You can tell...
customer_reviews.text: Once you put these in your hands, you can tell these are of high quality. The tension on the scissors is tight enough to hold them in place, but not too tight to use them with ease. They also cut very well. I highly recommend and would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin French

customer_reviews.title: Nice medical scissors
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put in my Orca medical bag. They fit perfectly. The scissors themselves are very sturdy and have a nice cutting sound when closing them. They are light weight but still have what it takes to cut what’s needed. Mine arrived brand new but with a few small spots of black rubbed off from manufacturing. Not a big deal for me definitely 5*’s!
customer_reviews.author: Bantha

customer_reviews.title: Great items
customer_reviews.text: These are well made ones, not the cheap ones. Penny cutters are a dime a dozen but getting a pair that isn't all loose at the joint is frustrating. Or loosen up with light use. These have not. Well made. Very happy them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Burkhart

customer_reviews.title: Can you say DURABLE?!
customer_reviews.text: Best med scissors I've owned to date. I've ran several different pair during my years in the Army and as a cop. These ones right here though take the cake. There ultra durable and the dark matte finish on them make them very concealable.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Roberts

customer_reviews.title: These things really are fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I find I am slowly losing interest in using any other kind of scissor or shear around the house, and keep ordering more and more of these. They are capable of delicate and accurate work, but will also cut through virtually anything, including heavy plastic, light sheet metal, and any fabric. Can't recommend them enough.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold up to routine heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 6 months. I have to routinely cut orthoglass splinting material. I’ve used other trauma shears that worked great for years. These simply will not hold up to heavy duty use. Now at the 9 month point they are essentially useless. I would put them at $5-7 for value. $12+? Definitely not.
customer_reviews.author: bb

customer_reviews.title: The best Trauma Shears I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Madison Supply as created the absolutely best Trauma Shears you could ever use! I'm a full-time paramedic and have never been disappointed. The only reason I just bought my second pair was because I believe a flight medic took mine while working on a patient. I'm sure he will order a pair when his disappear. - Scott
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.text: Nice Size, Nice Ergonomics. When trying to cut through multiple loose layers of something, like the packaging they come in ,the material tends to slide and makes cutting difficult. The serrations aren't pronounced enough to grab and hold these materials. If you're holding materials tightly together they work fine. I gave them the "old test" of cutting a penny in half. They cut it very easily. I would recommend these EMT Shears!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: A nice addition to my emergency medical kit
customer_reviews.text: The scissors are well made and should last a lifetime. I use them in my emergency medical kit that I keep in my truck and carry to all my grandkid's sporting events.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made tool.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew who is in Paramedic school. He says many of the current street Paramedics, and many in his class, now own this item. Those who have them and use them on a regular basis have high marks. Well designed, and if it is a Leatherman, I can rest assured it will be around for a long time. Only time on the street will let us know. I wish they had these back when I was a street Paramedic.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: So Safe & Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: My vet said I needed to trim the hair around my dog's eye to help him with his allergies. I order these scissors from Madison Supply & they work great. I was feeling very apprehensive about using scissors so close to Tucker's eyes, but I was able to trim the hair without any problems. And they arrived promptly via my Prime membership: in exactly 2 days. Love them! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Tucker's Mom

customer_reviews.title: the SHARPEST trauma shears I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I'm an ER physician, and prior to this I used these shears as a med student. These are by far the sharpest shears I have ever had. I've had multiple techs and other students ask where I got my shears from. I can just hold the shears open and use them almost like a letter opener, rather than having to struggle against cutting like scissors. These shears can cut through pennies!
customer_reviews.author: John Jiao

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges, great size to fit in scrubs back pocket if you aren't a utility belt aficionado
customer_reviews.text: Edges are super sharp. While they may dull with time, at $8 each it's not a tough decision to just order a new pair. I am not fond of the various utility belts people attach to their scrubs, since all I carry are my phone (in a case attached to the waist), a pen, and these scissors. It may depend on the version of the scrubs you wear, but in mine the length is just right, so that when the shorter handle and tips are aligned downward in the back of the pocket down, it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: GSM GSM

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pair of medical scissors
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didn't get these long ago. I need to occasionally remove wrapped bandages for my wife and these make it a whole lot less scary! They are made with a good angle of pivot to provide a powerful cutting action.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James

customer_reviews.title: Great medical shears
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using thses shears for the last two months for my bandage changes after getting burned. Very comfortable, sharp, and well made. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Goatherder

customer_reviews.title: Going on 2 years same pair; Best shears you will buy.
customer_reviews.text: I've cut through jeans, Carhartts, and even pennies just to see. Outside of work, I shredded enough clothing to fill a 100lb heavy bag. I got one pair without a serrated edge I think by mistake and honestly, I like it more than the serrated pair. I work in a hospital ER/ICU and they come in clutch. They have a notch on the inside of the handle that are perfect pliers for IV tubing/caps or whatever else you can think of using them for. I've had these for two years so far.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Stiff & short
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because these are stiff when cutting anything, especially gauze & with short cutting blades, it takes too long to cut things. It may be good for heavy duty items, but do not recommend for anything light/flimsy
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy E.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Short video attached of me cutting a piece of scrap leather. Handles seem very adequate but my hands are “medium” glove sized. I like the protector on the bottom to keep from gouging the patient.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel k.

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Well, as sheers go, they are solid and cut through materials as expected. I have them in my blow-out pouch (trauma kit) on my belt rigging. Hope to never have to use them, but will most likely have to.
customer_reviews.author: AvidOutdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Ortho Cast Tech here. This is exactly what I needed. I love these scissors! No they aren't the top of the line, but in a job where people will just walk off with your stuff if they like it, I don't want to spend $150 on something that I might lose. I buy them in doubles and use one on fabrics and the other on fiber glass and aluminium splints. When the one with the tough job gives out, I buy a new one for the fabrics and the other one gets bumped up for the tough work. I've only had one pair break on me (Dr. broke them), and had it replaced easily without breaking the bank. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Narie

customer_reviews.title: Good home but not trauma scissors
customer_reviews.text: Like: consistently sharp, cutting edges Dislike: Cutting axis binds making trauma use difficult; in trauma care, equipment use speed and reliability without unnecessary hand fatigue is essential.
customer_reviews.author: virgil hernandez, dpm, pc

customer_reviews.title: Great Scissors!!! Cuts through all kinds of things!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these because I had borrowed a pair when at a hospital. They worked so well at cutting a thick plastic tag, that I figured they'd come in handy at home. They DO! I keep a pair in my kitchen drawer and can cut through that bothersome stiff plastic molded clamshell packaging easily! The serrated bottom grabs whatever your cutting and holds onto it without slipping!!! Highly recommend these! NOT just for the medical profession!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri D.

customer_reviews.title: Only thing that might have made them better is if they had a bright colored handle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for our newly formed Community Emergency Response Team's (CERT) backpacks. No complaints yet. Only thing that might have made them better is if they had a bright colored handle, (orange, pink, red, yellow) so when they are set down on the ground/floor finding them would be more easy. The color does not affect their use.
customer_reviews.author: Civil Mediator

customer_reviews.title: Given as a gift - I’ve had a pair for years!
customer_reviews.text: Durable and reliable. I had originally purchased these scissors for my First Aid kit, but they ended up in my art materials box. Multi-functional and strong. I’m left handed, and they are very comfortable to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret R. Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: THEY WORK!
customer_reviews.text: The first thing I did with these shears was cut up the bill of an old hat(they teared right through it no problem), then I cut up an old pair of jeans. (Again with the same result.) if you work in any EMS services LE/Military or just a prepared civilian this is a must for any medkit.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor R.

customer_reviews.title: Good to have at home if you live with someone who is accident prone
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for school and I am yet to use them while I’m there. But I get good use of it at home for when I have to bandage someone up because they get to be a little wreckless at times
customer_reviews.author: Amm

customer_reviews.title: Great scissors.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the cheap ones that have junk plastic handles that break these will hold up very well. The blades are also top notch. These are worth more than they cost. And they are usable with either hand comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Jim White

customer_reviews.title: if they break buy new ones..
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to cut the nasty vegetable part off of freshly meals. Works great, 1 straight and easy but before you remove the film and then you can throw the whole side dish away with out any fuss.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great shears
customer_reviews.text: Top quality, the real deal. It is well worth the extra two dollars to buy these than the cheap knock offs that you would never want to have in a trauma kit. The handles are nicely molded and will give you a good grip and leverage. The steel is almost twice as thick as some of the knock off shears out there. If you ever need to use these only once you will be glad you spent the extra $2.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Trauma shears
customer_reviews.text: I have had to purchase these many times. They cut through clothes in no time. The scissors keep disappearing. My co-workers use them but do not return them. (I am a Trauma Nurse.)
customer_reviews.author: amazonian aficionado

customer_reviews.title: Great for trauma bays!
customer_reviews.text: These have survived in my scrub pocket for months while working on surgical specialities and they are still as sharp as the day I first got them. They fit in my female scrub pant pocket easily, though can obviously scratch phone screens if you forgot what all is on said pocket. They cut through clothes, multiple layers of bandages, and thick foam padding all easily in trauma bays. I was not expecting them to be that good for their price. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price, but
customer_reviews.text: They work great for the first few geans you shred than get dull fast. You will be buying a new pair soon if you use them a lot in which case I would recommend getting higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: matt

product_meta.title: Madison Supply - Medical Scissors, EMT and Trauma Shears, Premium Quality 7.5" - Fluoride-Coated with Non-Stick Blades 1-Pack
feature_bullets: PREMIUM QUALITY: Durable, Fluoride-coated non-stick surface with high-impact handles made to last for years
TACTICAL DESIGN: Stealth black-handled, EMT Shears, 7.5 inch long with high quality stainless steel blades with milled serrations made to cut through the toughest material
MEDICAL FIELD TESTED: Professionally designed for doctors, nurses, paramedics, EMT and EMS
SAFE & AUTOCLAVABLE: Blunt tip keeps your patient safe and are autoclavable to 290 F/143 C for thorough sterilization
GUARANTEED: We pride ourselves on the quality of our products. We offer a 60 day money back guarantee if you're not satisfied with our shears

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
